page.title: 06CLUBS IN GLENLIVET HALL
page.content: The hall is used most frequently in the winter by the bowling, badminton and youth clubs. The mother and toddler group meets one afternoon every week except during school holidays. Mothers with children under school age meet to chat or to help the children draw, paint, model, play games or just let them sleep in their prams. A piping class meets once a week and many local youngsters have learned to play the bagpipes under the excellent tuition of a local man. {The Community Association }holds its meetings every two months in the hall. The District and Regional Councillors for the area attend these meetings and give advice on any matters which are giving rise to concern.The Councillors can take any problem back to the relevant Council department.
